newsitem.title: INDIA: Microsoft in alliance with India's TCS.
newsitem.headline: Microsoft in alliance with India's TCS.

text.p: Microsoft Corp. on Thursday announced a strategic alliance with India's Tata Consultancy Services (TCS), making TCS its premier consulting partner.
"TCS will be one of the prime engines of Microsoft products," Sanjay Parthasarathy, Microsoft's regional director for the Indian subcontinent, told reporters.
Microsoft Corporation India Pvt. Ltd is a fully-owned subsidiary of the US-based Microsoft Corporation.
"India has the potential to be a worldwide leader in software development and value added services," Parthasarathy said.
"We are very excited about our partnership with Microsoft," said S. Ramadorai, TCS's chief executive officer.
TCS is India's largest information technology consulting organisation. TCS will establish a consulting group to focus on Microsoft technologies and products, officials said.
Microsoft in turn will provide TCS Consultants with extensive training and early access to Microsoft products still in the testing stage.
"In short, what we mean by this alliance is leveraging mutual strengths for customer products," TCS's Ramadorai said.
